title: Augusta County: Jedediah Hotchkiss to Sara A. Hotchkiss, September 24, 1864
summary: Hotchkiss describes to his wife a battle at Fisher's Hill, Virginia, in which the Confederate troops broke ranks and fled. He also comments briefly on affairs at home.
keywords: Battle Description, Prisons/Prisoners, Death/Casualties, Women, African Americans, Slavery, Home Front, American Civil War
